text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to explain that the state liability framework requires an individual right which has been breached with a causal link. The candidate answer focuses entirely on administrative and political avenues for challenging the bill (complaints to DPA, Commission infringement, Parliament petition, Ombudsman) and mentions the judicial route only briefly, suggesting a preliminary reference to the CJEU or a direct action under Art. 263 TFEU. It does not explicitly explain the requirements of the *state liability framework* (Francovich/Brasserie du P\u00eacheur doctrine), which specifically requires the breach of an EU right, the breach to be sufficiently serious, and a causal link between the breach and the damage suffered by the individual. Since the required explanation of the state liability framework elements is absent, the criterion is not met.", "criterion_id": "6b1a7582-8c59-4663-95e0-c92590cf3e4c"}
